architecture_overview: AppImageKit is a toolchain for creating self-contained Linux applications (AppImages). The architecture includes a CLI frontend, build system, package manager integration, and runtime environment for executing packaged applications.

components.name: CLI Frontend
components.description: Command-line interface for user interaction and initiating build processes

components.name: Build System
components.description: Core component handling packaging logic, dependency resolution, and AppImage creation

components.name: Package Manager
components.description: Integration with Linux package managers (e.g., apt, dnf) for dependency handling

components.name: Runtime Environment
components.description: Execution environment for AppImages, including sandboxing and compatibility layers

data_flows.description: User input parameters and configuration directives
Dependency resolution and package metadata exchange
